title: AgroIsland engages in international trade in wheat

content.question: Respond to all parts of the question. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to "Calculate," you must show how you arrived at your final answer. In the small country of AgroIsland, the equilibrium price of wheat is <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per bushel. Wheat is produced in a competitive industry. The world market price of wheat is <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> per bushel. (a) Assume that AgroIsland currently does not engage in international trade in wheat. Draw a correctly labeled graph to illustrate the market for wheat in AgroIsland and indicate the following. (i) The equilibrium price, labeled <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (ii) The equilibrium quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q star" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>*</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> (iii) The domestic producer surplus, shaded completely and labeled <math alttext="P S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>PS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (b) On the graph from part (a), show each of the following for AgroIsland if it engages in free trade in the world wheat market. (i) The world price of a bushel of wheat, labeled <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (ii) The quantity of wheat supplied by domestic producers, labeled <math alttext="Q sub P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> (iii) The domestic consumer surplus after trade, shaded completely and labeled <math alttext="C S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CS</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (c) Given your answers in part (b), how does each of the following change if AgroIsland engages in international trade in the wheat market? (i) The domestic consumer surplus (ii) The domestic producer surplus

A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to "Calculate," you must show how you arrived at your final answer. Wheat is produced in a competitive industry. The world market price of wheat is <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>20</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> per bushel. (a) Assume that AgroIsland currently does not engage in international trade in wheat. Draw a correctly labeled graph to illustrate the market for wheat in AgroIsland and indicate the following. topic.text: 2.6: Market Equilibrium and Consumer and Producer Surplus

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
